case_vignette: A 8-year-old male with no significa   nt past medical history presents to the emergency room with fever, headache, malaise and rhinorrhea ongoing for past two day   s with re   cent known tick exposure. Parents den y any recent medic   ation exposures. He is admitted to the h ospital and over the next few days, he develops a rash beginning on the ankles and wrists    that progressively spread onto the trunk. Phy sical examination reveals blanching erythematous macules on ankles, wrists, and trunk with few scattered    pete  chiae and purpura on the bilateral ankles. question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing fever, headache, malaise, and a runny nose for the past two days.
Have you noticed any rashes or unusual spots on your skin?
Yes, I have a rash that started on my ankles and wrists and has been spreading to my trunk, along with some small red and purple spots on my ankles.
Do the spots on your ankles blanch when you press on them?
Yes, the spots on my ankles do blanch when pressed.
Have you been in contact with anyone who is sick or have you traveled recently?
I haven't been in contact with anyone who is sick or traveled recently, but I was exposed to a tick.
Do you have any joint pain or swelling associated with these symptoms?
No, I don't have any joint pain or swelling.
Final Diagnosis: Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever
